title: Drawing, "Project for a Painted Oblong Ceiling", 1800–15
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and green, gray, and brown wash on paper, lined with white heavy textured paper with lithographed frame and geometric lines in pen and black ink over graphite
inscribed: Inscribed on recto of the support: Enrico Tozzani [?Sozzani]
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Depiction of a quarter of a ceiling viewed from below.  View into a cupola with a fluted tambour.  The dome rests on the octagonal entablature.  Its sides are supported by arches through which landscapes can be seen.  The panels of the parapet at the sides are decorated with pairs of festoons supporting each other.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for a Painted Oblong Ceiling", 1800–15.
1800–15. Pen and brown ink, brush and green, gray, and brown wash on paper, lined with white heavy textured paper with lithographed frame and geometric lines in pen and black ink over graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6614.
